translated: do not despise the wise one.
“Having given up the five strands of sense pleasure,
having gone forth from the home life out of faith,
do not have craving for these,
do not return to the world.
and with mindfulness directed to the body,
and give up the underlying tendency to conceit;

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ bhagavā āyasmantaṁ rāhulaṁ imāhi gāthāhi abhiṇhaṁ ovadatīti.
analyzed: ittham sudam bhagavā āyasmantam rāhulam imāhi gāthāhi ovadati iti
translated: Thus the Blessed One often advised the venerable Rāhula with this verse.
The eleventh sutta on Rāhula is finished.
